sentence.Network_en: Miro is the most inventive and entertaining of surrealist painters.
sentence.Network_cn: 米罗是最具创造力和娱乐性的超现实主义画家。

sentence.Network_en: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
sentence.Network_cn: 它激发我在自己烹饪时更富创造性。

sentence.Network_en: She has a highly inventive mind.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的头脑非常善于创新。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French inventif, -ive or medieval Latin inventivus, from Latin invenire 'discover' (see invent)

entry.tran: 善于发明的;有创造才能的
entry.def: An inventive person is good at inventing things or has clever and original ideas.

example.tran: 斯特罗曼永远求新的舞蹈设计

example.ex: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
example.tran: 它激发我在自己烹饪时更富创造性。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of persons or artifacts) marked by independence and creativity in thought or action;

sentences.sentence: "the invention of the knitting frame by another ingenious English clergyman"- Lewis Mumford

auth_sentence.content: Yorke remains consistently inventive, whatever company he keeps.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yorke remains consistently inventive, whatever company he keeps.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yorke remains consistently inventive, whatever company he keeps.

auth_sentence.content: Academies may be said to be obstructive to...inventive genius.
auth_sentence.res_content: Academies may be said to be obstructive to...inventive genius.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Academies may be said to be obstructive to...inventive genius.

auth_sentence.content: Traditional dishes were complemented by more inventive Mediterranean fare.
auth_sentence.res_content: Traditional dishes were complemented by more inventive Mediterranean fare.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Traditional dishes were complemented by more inventive Mediterranean fare.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 重大的,重要的,多变故的
stems_affixes.word_buile: event[n.事件,事情]+ful充满……的→事件多→多变故的
event[n.事件,事情]+ual……的→出事之后[最终]的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 善于发明或创造的,有发明或创造才能的
stems_affixes.word_buile: invent[v.发明,创造;捏造,虚构]+ive……的→adj.善于发明或创造的,有发明或创造才能的
prevent[v.[from]预防,防止,阻止,制止,妨碍]+ive……的→adj.预防性的
eventual[adj.最后的,结局的,最终的]+ly表副词→adv.最后, 终于
eventual最终的+ity表名词→最终可能发生的
inter之间+vent走+ion表名词→走在二者之间→干涉
invent发明,创造+ion表名词→n.发明, 创造
convention集会;习俗+ality表名词→n.陈规陋习,因袭传统
vent风→v.发泄[情绪],开孔 n.孔,口
ventilate[v.使通风;给…装通风设备]+ion表名词→n.通风
vent风→v.发泄[情绪],开孔 n.孔,口
vent风+ilate=ate表动词→v.使通风;给…装通风设备

Sentence.sentence: These poems were verbally inventive and fluent, but also "strangely boring".

means.word_mean: 有发明才能的;显示创造力的

sentences.en: This device is the offspring of his inventive mind.
sentences.cn: 这一装置是他那长于发明的头脑的产儿。
